name: Overview

[{"id":"0f07c99d-afdf-41ca-bd2d-dacc18721633","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: visit_FunctionDef","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"11160c88-ba57-43e2-8e2f-82e40e10164b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_FunctionDef","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is the primary handler for standard Python function definitions (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"def my_func():","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). It manages the lifecycle of encountering a new function: defining it in the current namespace, establishing its internal scope, and importantly, processing any decorators attached to it.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9fbf099f-3b36-47df-ad0f-d3f04f57a616","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Functions are the building blocks of Python logic. Correctly analyzing them involves two main challenges:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9f060e36-3c76-4223-b6a3-eed38d2a33e8","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scope isolation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Variables defined inside a function shouldn't leak out, but arguments passed in must be visible inside.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ee28ba0d-63f6-4fa5-9862-fbfdf3a776e5","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Decorators:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" In Python, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"@decorator","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is actually a function call that transforms the defined function. If the analyzer ignores decorators, it might completely misunderstand what the function does (e.g., a route handler in Flask or a static method in a class).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9eec0d32-b31f-439f-a43f-6f9f6a24a25c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"42f10d89-7ad1-49c8-b7e2-1e733ea6cb1d","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Definition & Scope:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"bc41dc48-3c4c-46ad-a3b7-10a4ae0430a0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It calculates the current namespace (e.g., inside a module or a class).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ada09606-f5da-4e1d-8c07-a0015e0fbe48","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"_handle_function_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (a shared helper) to analyze arguments and creating the core Definition object.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f22ba66f-0015-489b-81af-74ff5fde97a9","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It ensures a dedicated Scope exists for the function body and registers the function name in the parent scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"146901d6-75c4-4fed-99f2-b2cba241014c","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Decorator Processing (The Complex Part):","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[{"id":"97eaadc5-1ac0-4602-a79a-da472e453e2a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It iterates through ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"node.decorator_list","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Crucially, it reverses them because Python applies decorators from bottom to top.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"85125d50-0369-4849-82ce-0471dd196b5d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It treats decorators as ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"function calls","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b61d9f41-fa0a-4975-ae89-1b1b3e66a3ff","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"First Decorator:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" For the first decorator (closest to the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it simulates calling the decorator function, passing the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"function definition itself","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as an argument.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"09869911-d4d6-4a3f-a774-541bbafc498c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Chained Decorators:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If there are multiple decorators (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"@auth","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"@log","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it simulates a chain: the result of the first decorator call is passed as the argument to the second, and so on.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4bc429c4-cca8-4408-83c3-642ea7fb1351","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This logic uses ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_Call","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with a special ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"decorator=True","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" flag to simulate these transformations.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"95209154-a3c6-403c-a1f0-93d78240d15f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Code:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"98a1acbe-93c1-4ae7-abdb-4d3b89b6623d","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"@logging
@validate
def process(data):
    pass","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d7f14c82-c119-4776-8a20-fc0802ff14b6","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Analysis Steps:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3dfa8f5d-44fe-4c70-8470-1e6d08d71337","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_FunctionDef","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" creates the definition for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"process","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a500d2dc-de8d-4c41-bca2-6e9e54088ab8","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It sees decorators. It reverses them: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"[@validate, @logging]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"59e2272b-c0ad-4d71-ac21-1f45bd04e235","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Step A:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It simulates calling ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"validate(process)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9e1ce043-6015-4dd5-87ea-8df5f87f7efa","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Step B:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It calculates the "return value" of that call (let's call it ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"validated_func","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e7c98e64-2d51-498e-a23d-0c7a084ae13d","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Step C:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It simulates calling ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"logging(validated_func)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5ee4e3d7-0a76-4397-b813-a4dbe8ad88f0","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This accurately mimics Python's runtime behavior, ensuring that if ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"validate","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" adds an attribute to the function, the analyzer knows about it.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"41cdd056-45ca-42ad-beab-03df210b5eaf","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
